Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Theosr
Reviews.Content: The hotels is in the middle of the action .I'm talking about the traffic in Istanbul(we travel with cars). Cleanliness is bad. Little rooms .Bad breakfast. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hotels”
Reviews.Author: Ben-aus-Rostock
Reviews.Content: one of the worst hotels I've ever been to: Hotel Sevcan, which is a Turkish-Airline contract hotel and a shame for the airline... bad and rude reception, smoky rooms, not working air condition, dirty beds and bathroom, already used half-empty shampoo bottles... Despite the fairly good dinner, this was not the compensation for a missed flight, one would expect or which I remembered I got from BA or KLM before.

Reviews.Title: “this is the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: vasmir
Reviews.Content: i stayed there one night as i had intermediate stop in Istanbul for more than 12 hours. and THY took me to this hotel. this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. staff is really rude. my best recommendation is to avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hole in the Wall”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim_gsa
Reviews.Content: This is no hotel ,it is a hole in the wall ..Anyone going to Istanbul must beware of this place reeking with smoke filled rooms, bedsheets with ants ,corridors dark airconditioning that does not work ,and when you complain the scam is that a technician comes who declares the ac is working and his word is final and that only you are making complaint and all other guests are sleeping peacefully so ac is working . This hotel earnes money from gullible tourists and from the guests that Turkish Airlines Free Hotel sends ,as sheep for slaughter to be awake all night ....both are complicit in this scam and earn backwards commision for every sheep (read guest sent to this hole in the wall) read its revies dated 2006 nothing has changed everything is same .NEVER EVER stay in this hotel even for free voucher of Turkish Airlines who get commision from every guest (sheep)sent there ...awful ,pathetic,filthy I run out of words for this hole in the wall

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful!!”
Reviews.Author: moshinuk
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel near airport and I decided to stay in this so called 4 star hotel. I paid $60 a night for this place but I had to spend $40 a day on taxi just to get to airport! The hotel is 4 kilometres away from airport but it is not accessible! Taxies must travel a long distance to get to the hotel because it is in the wrong side of the motorway! The room was dirty, the toilet had filth around it, there was long hair all over the room, the place was noisy and I found a condom in the corner of the room. Just stay away, this place was really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Sevcan”
Reviews.Author: Sullyman3
Reviews.Content: Grumpy desk clerk with major attitude Air conditioning did not work, and it was +40 that day. They kept saying it would be fixed in 10 minutes, and it still wasn't working when we left the next day. It was a hot night with little sleep. Hotel is old & poorly maintained - the klunky old AC was symptomatic. We had ordered a hotel taxi to take our family to the airport early in am. There was no taxi at requested time. Desk clerk kept saying 5 minutes. After 30 min, it turned out the hotel taxi had broken down the previous evening and wasn't operating. We had to scramble to get commercial taxis and almost missed our flight. Expressed displeasure to manager, who was indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Originally Good Facilities, Location Only Good For Airport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good points: * Very good security and service. * McDonald's around the corner with good Mediterranean salad. * The facilities seem like they were originally pretty high quality and extensive, but, except for the outer pool, a bit run down and unused. * Nice beadspread, nice sized room and furnishings. * Compared to most hotels, close to airport, cheaper transportation to/from airport. Bad Points: * Located on opposite side of airport from the cultural old town area. Even further from the night life area. Expensive transportation to those areas, or very long commute with cheaper transportation, especially during rush hour. This is the worst thing about the hotel. Thus if you are single it is probably a mistake to stay there unless you are staying only one night and not going downton, even at discounted rates. Transportation to/from airport ($5) is cheaper than to downtown hotels (about $20), but you pay taxi about $20 if you want to go downtown! *Air conditioning is a joke. Prepare for discomfort on hot days. * No electric hot water carafe in room for making coffee. It seems they had never heard of such a thing. I don't know how many stars it takes to provide one, but I find them very convenient. Also, although the towels were okay, I wish there were wash cloths in the bathroom. These things may be common not to have in Istanbul, hotels, because they were not in another similar priced hotel I stayed at in Istanbul. * Management seems greedy/needy in pushing you to get drinks (see above about hot water carafe) and eat at restaurant. * Entrance has an airport type security thing you walk through, which seems like it must be just pretense. * There was a fan in the window of the shower stall, which went on automatically when taking shower, which was nice. But bizarrely, it's electric cord hung down about a foot into the shower stall. Don't they know about electricity and water? * The little shampoo bottle, a vestige of when the hotel was a 3+ star hotel, was half-full (do they refill it or leave it there until it is all used up!) * The halls are very dark, lighted by movement sensing lights that seem too dim. Can't hardly see at all if have sunglasses on.
